isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - FE 300, RE 200, RE 300 - RE 200/RE 300 LIGHT SYSTEMS - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the on position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

entry.para: Check fuse F24 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At F24 and circuit A13H, measure voltage to ground.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A13H/A13, then repair.
At body builder connector (169) and with transmission in reverse, measure voltage from cavity D, circuit A71A to ground.
Problem exists in body circuitry. Refer to body builder manual.
At body builder connector (169), install jumper from cavity D, circuit A71A to ground. Disconnect back-up light switch connector (7505). At connector, measure resistance from circuit A71A to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A71A, or engine/ chassis harness conn. (9850) or platform harness conn. (2), then repair.
At connector (7505), measure voltage from circuit V71 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit V71, or engine/ chassis harness conn. (9850), or platform harness connector (2), then repair.
At switch (7505) and with transmission in reverse, measure resistance from black wire to white wire.
Remove jumper and reconnect (7505). Back-up light switch circuitry checks good.

svcsubproc.title: Headlight System With Tilt Column and Douglas Turn Signal

table.title: Headlight System With Tilt Column and Douglas Turn Signal

entry.para: Remove fuses F14 and F15. Check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse(s).
At fuse F14, measure voltage from A14C/A14D to ground.
Install fuses. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A14C/A14D, then repair. Install fuses.
Remove headlight switch connector (23). Measure voltage from circuit A50A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A50A, then repair.
At connector (23), measure voltage from circuit A50 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A50, then repair.
With headlight switch (23) in park position, measure resistance across terminals that were connected to circuits A50A and A62, and A50A and A58.
(23), across A50A to A62 and A50A to A58.
With headlight switch (23) in on position, measure resistance across terminals that were connected to circuits A50 and A51.
Reconnect connector (23) and disconnect body builder connector (169). With headlight switch in park or on position, measure voltage from cavity H, circuit A58 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A58, then repair.
Reconnect connector (169) and disconnect dimmer switch connector (4). With headlight switch on, measure voltage from circuit A51 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A51, then repair.
With dimmer switch in the low beam position, measure resistance at dimmer pigtail, from green wire to blue wire.
Dimmer pigtail, green wire to blue wire.
With dimmer switch in high beam position, measure resistance at dimmer pigtail, from green wire to brown wire.
Dimmer pigtail, green wire to brown wire.
Reconnect (27) and disconnect body builder connector (170). With dimmer switch in low beam position and headlight switch on, measure voltage from cavity C, circuit A53B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A53B/A53, then repair.
With dimmer switch in high beam position and headlight switch on, measure voltage from cavity D, circuit A52B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A52B/A52, then repair.
Reconnect (170) and disconnect green cluster connector (11). With headlight switch on and dimmer switch in high beam position, measure voltage from cavity 4, circuit A52A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A52A, then repair.
At (11) and with switches still set, measure voltage from cavity 4, circuit A52A to cavity 2, circuit A28-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A28-G/ A11-G or platform ground, then repair.
Headlight, dimmer switch and high beam indicator circuits check good. If condition persists, refer to body builder manual.

svcsubproc.title: Headlight System With Stationary Column and International Turn Signal

entry.para: Remove fuses F14 and F15. Check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse(s).
At fuse F14, measure voltage from A14C/A14D to ground.
Install fuses. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A14C/A14D, then repair. Install fuses.
Disconnect headlight switch connector (23). Measure voltage from circuit A50 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A50, or for open in fuse F15, then repair.
With headlight switch in the on position, measure resistance from terminal that was connected to circuit A50 to terminal that was connected to circuit A51/A66.
Reconnect headlight switch (23) and remove lift-to-dim relay (100). Move headlight switch to on position, and at relay socket cavity B, circuit A51F, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A51F or A51A/A66, then repair.
Disconnect headlight dimmer switch connector (6) and at circuit A51-G, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A51-G/A11-GB, then repair.
With the headlight dimmer switch in the low beam position, measure resistance from cavity C to B of connector (6) that goes to switch.
With the headlight dimmer switch in the high beam position, measure resistance from cavity C to B of connector (6) that goes to switch.
At connector (6) that goes to headlight dimmer switch, measure resistance from cavity A to B.
With the headlight dimmer switch held in the flash- to-pass position, measure resistance from cavity A to B of connector (6) that goes to switch.
Reconnect connector (6) and place dimmer switch in low beam position. At lift-to- dim relay (100) socket cavity A, measure resistance of circuit A51D to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A51D, then repair.
Bench test relay (100) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test relay (100) by applying +12V to pin 85, ground to pin 86 and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install relay (100) and remove flash-to- pass relay (101). With headlight switch on, measure voltage at socket cavity B, circuit A51C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A51C/A50B, then repair.
While holding dimmer switch in flash-to- pass position and at relay socket (101) cavity A, measure resistance from circuit A51E to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A51E, then repair.
Bench test relay (101) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test relay (101) by applying +12V to pin 85, ground to pin 86 and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install relay (101) and disconnect body builder connector (170). While holding dimmer switch in flash-to- pass position, measure voltage from circuit A52B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A52B/A52D, then repair.
With headlight switch on, move dimmer switch to high beam position. At (170), measure voltage from circuit A52B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A52B/A52C, then repair.
With headlight switch on, move dimmer switch to low beam position. At (170), measure voltage from circuit A53B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53B/A53A, then repair.
Does high beam indicator illuminate properly?
Disconnect dash cluster connector (11). With headlight switch on and dimmer switch in high beam position, measure voltage from circuit A52A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A52A, then repair.
At (11) and with switches still set, measure voltage from circuit A52A to A28-G.
Check lamp. If OK, replace cluster.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A28-G/ A11-G, then repair.
Headlight, dimmer switch and high beam indicator circuits check good. If condition persists, refer to body builder manual.
Check fuse F12 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At F12 and circuit A14A/A14D, measure voltage to ground.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A14A/A14D, then repair. Re-install fuse.
Remove stop light connector (78) and (79). At connector (78), measure voltage from circuit A70B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A70B or A70, then repair.
With brakes applied, measure resistance across switch terminals of each switch (78) and (79).
Reconnect stop light switch connectors (78) and (79) and disconnect body builder connector (169). With brakes applied and at (169), measure voltage from circuit A70B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A70B or A70C, then repair.
Stop light switch circuitry to body builder connector (169) checks good.
Remove fuse F21 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
The following steps must be performed with the headlight switch on. At fuse F21, measure voltage from A62 to ground.
Re-install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A62, then repair. Re-install fuse.
Disconnect panel light switch connector (22). At harness connector, measure voltage from circuit A62A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A62A, then repair.
At connector (22), measure voltage across circuit A62A to A62-GD.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A62-GD/ A11-G, then repair.
Adjust switch (22) to bright position and measure resistance across pigtail blue wire to yellow wire.
Reconnect switch connector (22) and disconnect bussed connector (8). At circuit A62H, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A62H, then repair.
Reconnect connector (8) and disconnect body builder connector (169). At (169), measure voltage from circuit A62J to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A62J, then repair.
Reconnect connector (169) and disconnect green dash cluster connector (11). At harness connector (11), cavity 1, measure voltage from circuit A62C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A62C, then repair.
At (11), measure voltage across cavity 1, circuit A62C to cavity 11, circuit A62-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A62-GB/ A11-G, then repair.
Circuits to center cluster check good. Reconnect (11) and replace any lamps that fail to work. Do all lamps work?
Disconnect natural colored dash cluster connector (12). At harness connector (12), cavity 1, measure voltage from circuit A62D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A62D, then repair.
At (12), measure voltage across cavity 1, circuit A62D to cavity 10, circuit A62-GC.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A62-GC/ A11-G, then repair.
Circuits to center cluster check good. Reconnect (12) and replace any lamps that fail to work. Do all lamps work?
Disconnect automatic transmission light connector (7) and measure voltage from circuit A62E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A62E, then repair.
At (7), measure voltage across circuit A62E to circuit A62-GE.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A62-GE/ A11-G, then repair.
Automatic transmission light circuits check good. Reconnect connector (7). Does light operate?
Disconnect cruise/throttle set/coast switch panel light (150) and measure voltage from circuit A62L to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A62L, then repair.
At connector (150), measure voltage across circuit A62L to A62-GF.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A62-GF/ A11-G, then repair.
Cruise/throttle set/coast switch panel light circuits check good. Reconnect connector (150). Does light operate?
Disconnect cruise/throttle on/off switch panel light (150) and measure voltage from circuit A62M to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A62M, then repair.
At connector (150), measure voltage across circuit A62M to A62-GH.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A62-GH/ A11-G, then repair.
Cruise/throttle on/off switch panel light circuits check good. Reconnect connector (150). Does light operate?
Disconnect ATC switch panel light (150) and measure voltage from circuit A62N to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A62N, then repair.
At connector (150), measure voltage across circuit A62N to A62-GJ
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A62-GJ/ A62-GH/A11-G, then repair.
ATC switch panel light circuits check good. Reconnect connector (150). Does light operate?
Remove fuse F5 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F5, and at circuit A66F, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A66F, then repair.
Remove fuse F6 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F6, and at circuit A12B/A12, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A12B/A12, then repair.
Disconnect connector (224) and with headlight switch in headlight position and dimmer switch in dim position, at (4) circuit A66C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A66C, then repair.
Move dimmer switch to high beam position and at connector (4) circuit A66E, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage circuit A66E, then repair.
Disconnect connector (165) and reconnect (4). With switches still set, at (165) measure voltage from circuit A66E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage circuit A66E, then repair.
Move dimmer switch to dim position and at connector (165) circuit A66C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage circuit A66C, then repair.
At connector (165) and circuit A66-GA, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A66-GA, then repair.
Move key switch to accessories position and at connector (165) circuit A66, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A66, then repair.
Reconnect connector (165). DRL circuits check good.
